content:
The namespace line is necessary for some css code. For others, it can be omitted. It's only needed once at the top of the file.

Your code should work for the Folder Pane, but for the Threads Pane, delete the line in green with Threads pane:

See the attached picture that shows the result with this code: 

@namespace html url("http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml");  #folderPane { background-color: #87CEFA !important; font-family: Times !important; color: navy !important; }  table[is="tree-view-table"]{ background: #87CEFA !important; font-family: Times !important; color: navy !important; }
creator: sfhowes

creator: SaratogaGap

content: I've moved a folder by drag and drop from one subfolder of Local Folders to another without losing anything, so I don't know why it isn't working for you. Do you have the profile folder in the default location on the C drive, or is there anything unconventional with your setup?
creator: sfhowes

content:
This suggestion assumes you are using Windows and that the profile is in the default location: On OLD computer: - exit thunderbird (this is IMPORTANT) - copy c:\users\<yourid>appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external drive On New Computer: - install thunderbird if not already installed. - exit thunderbird - copy the thunderbird folder on external drive to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the default thunderbird folder. - start thunderbird and all should be there.

TIP: be sure to do periodic backups the same way to simplify doing restore if needed.

content:
Hi, If you want to view it in the full message view, you can do the following: - Select a message - Click on "More" - then click on "Customize" - then from the dialog, select "Always show sender full address" - Hit Done.

I believe this is the only possible way right now.

content:
Hi, The storage limitation is on Google's side "For users on the Basic or Business Starter plans, the individual storage limit is 30 GB per user. This storage is shared across Gmail, Google Drive, and Google Photos."

You cold try to delete some old messages, but also, please look at your google account and see what takes a lot of space!

content:
A quale assistenza ti riferisci? Ti ricordo che Thunderbird è un programma gratuito per cui non offre assistenza di nessun genere. Esiste questo forum ma è frequentato solo da utenti volontari.

Per il tuo problema:

  1. Gli account che hai configurato in Thunderbird sono di tipo POP3 o IMAP?
  2. Hai fatto dei backup periodici?

Se non hai backup recenti, fanne subito uno -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

content:
Do you have any kind of app like CCleaner or Privazer that acts on the TB profile?

Open the profile from Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder. Are any config. files like prefs.js or session.json or xulstore.json read-only files?
creator: sfhowes

content:
There are prefs-1 through prefs-11 js files dated from 2020 to July 2023. There's a session.json.backup and sessioncheckpoints.json file dated today. There's a xulstore.json file dated today that's read only.

I don't think I have any applications that act on the TB profile, but it's possible I clicked on something at some point and didn't realize it.
creator: chris_gulli

content:
The prefs-N.js files are created when TB crashes. There must be a prefs.js file that stores the current settings, and like xulstore.json and session.json, it should not be read-only.

Right-click the Windows Start button, Task Manager, and look on the startup tab for any app that might be resetting TB settings.
creator: sfhowes

content:
If you have the correct settings, i.e. poczta.o2.pl on 993 (IMAP) or 995 (POP), SSL/TLS, normal password, email address, the error might occur if 2-step verification is set for the account but you're using the account password instead of an app password.

https://pomoc.o2.pl/jak-skonfigurowac-program-pocztowy

Has access by TB been activated?
